person module¶

Person Module

This module defines abstract Person class which can be inherited from to achieve polymorphic behavior :module: person

class person.Person(name, age, email)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a basic person with name, age, and email attributes.

This class provides functionality for personal information management, including validation, email access, and serialization.

Variables:

  • name – Full name of the person

  • age – Age of the person

  • _Person__email – Private email address of the person

classmethod deserialize(data)[source]¶

Reconstruct a Person instance from serialized data.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Dictionary containing person’s serialized information

Returns:

Reconstructed Person instance

Return type:

Person

get_email()[source]¶

Retrieve the person’s email address.

Returns:

Email address

Return type:

str

introduce()[source]¶

Print a friendly introduction of the person.

Outputs a string with name, age, and email information.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

serialize()[source]¶

Convert person’s information to a serializable dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary containing person’s attributes

Return type:

dict

set_email(new_email)[source]¶

Update the person’s email address.

Parameters:

new_email (str) – New email address to set

Raises:

ValueError – If the new email is not in a valid format

validate()[source]¶

Perform comprehensive validation of person’s attributes.

Calls individual validation methods for email, age, and name.

Raises:

ValueError – If any validation check fails

validate_age()[source]¶

Validate the person’s age.

Ensures the age is a positive number.

Raises:

ValueError – If age is zero or negative

validate_email()[source]¶

Validate the email address format.

Uses a simple regex pattern to check email validity.

Raises:

ValueError – If email does not match the expected format

validate_name()[source]¶

Validate the person’s name.

Checks that the name is at least two characters long after stripping whitespace.

Raises:

ValueError – If name is less than two characters long
